## Skills measured as of December 23, 2025
### Audience profile
As a Microsoft Azure AI engineer, you build, manage, and deploy AI solutions that leverage Azure AI.
Your responsibilities include participating in all phases of AI solutions development, including:
1. Requirements definition and design
2. Development
3. Deployment
4. Integration
5. Maintenance
6. Performance tuning
7. Monitoring
You work with solution architects to translate their vision. You also work with data scientists, data engineers, Internet of Things (IoT) specialists, infrastructure administrators, and other software developers to:
1. Build complete and secure end-to-end AI solutions.
2. Integrate AI capabilities in other applications and solutions.
As an Azure AI engineer, you have experience developing solutions that use languages such as:
1. Python
2. C#
You should be able to use Representational State Transfer (REST) APIs and SDKs to build secure image processing, video processing, natural language processing, knowledge mining, and generative AI solutions on Azure. You should:
1. Understand the components that make up the Azure AI portfolio and the available data storage options.
2. Be able to apply responsible AI principles.
### Skills at a glance
1. Plan and manage an Azure AI solution (20–25%)
2. Implement generative AI solutions (15–20%)
3. Implement an agentic solution (5–10%)
4. Implement computer vision solutions (10–15%)
5. Implement natural language processing solutions (15–20%)
6. Implement knowledge mining and information extraction solutions (15–20%)
### Plan and manage an Azure AI solution (20-25%)
#### Select the appropriate Microsoft Foundry Services
1. Select the appropriate service for a generative AI solution
2. Select the appropriate service for a computer vision solution
3. Select the appropriate service for a natural language processing solution
4. Select the appropriate service for a speech solution
5. Select the appropriate service for an information extraction solution
6. Select the appropriate service for a knowledge mining solution
#### Plan, create and deploy a Microsoft Foundry Service
1. Plan for a solution that meets Responsible AI principles
2. Create an Azure AI resource
3. Choose the appropriate AI models for your solution
4. Deploy AI models using the appropriate deployment options
5. Install and utilize the appropriate SDKs and APIs
6. Determine a default endpoint for a service
7. Integrate Microsoft Foundry Services into a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102#skills-measured-as-of-december-23,-2025"},{"title":"Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution","content":"# Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution

## Overview

AI-102: Develop AI solutions in Azure is intended for software developers wanting to build AI infused applications that leverage Azure AI Foundry and other Azure AI services. Topics in this course include developing generative AI apps, building AI agents, and solutions that implement computer vision and information extraction. The course will use C# or Python as the programming language.

#### Audience Profile

This course was designed for software engineers concerned with building, managing and deploying AI solutions that leverage Azure AI Foundry and other Azure AI services. They are familiar with C# or Python and have knowledge on using REST-based APIs and SDKs to build generative AI, computer vision, language analysis, and information extraction solutions on Azure.

## Updates to the exam
Our exams are updated periodically to reflect skills that are required to perform a role. We have included two versions of the Skills Measured objectives depending on when you are taking the exam.
We always update the English language version of the exam first. Some exams are localized into other languages, and those are updated approximately eight weeks after the English version is updated. While Microsoft makes every effort to update localized exams as noted, there may be times when the localized versions of an exam are not updated on this schedule. Other available languages are listed in the **Schedule Exam** section of the **Exam Details** webpage. If the exam isn't available in your preferred language, you can request an additional 30 minutes to complete the exam.
#### Note
The bullets that follow each of the skills measured are intended to illustrate how we are assessing that skill. Related topics may be covered in the exam.
#### Note
Most questions cover features that are general availability (GA). The exam may contain questions on Preview features if those features are commonly used.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102#updates-to-the-exam"},{"title":"Generative AI solutions for developers","content":"# Generative AI solutions for developers
## Tools and services from Microsoft
You can use low-code and no-code generative AI tools and services from Microsoft to help you build some or all of your solution. Various Azure services can play pivotal roles. Each contributes to the efficiency, scalability, and robustness of the solution.
### API and SDKs for a code-centric approach
Every generative AI solution uses an LLM. Azure OpenAI gives you all the features in models like GPT-4.
| Product | Description| 
|  --- | ---  |
| **Azure OpenAI** | A hosted service that gives you access to powerful language models like GPT-4. Use APIs to create embeddings, build chat features, and customize results to fit your needs. |

### Execution environments
You need a service to run your business logic, presentation logic, or APIs for generative AI in your apps.
| Product | Description| 
|  --- | ---  |
| **Azure App Service (or other container-based cloud services)** | Host web interfaces or APIs for users to interact with your RAG chat system. Quickly develop, deploy, and scale agentic web apps. Host MCP servers or OpenAPI servers on App Service. Easily manage the front end of your system. See [Integrate AI into your Azure App Service applications](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/overview-ai-integration). |
| **Azure Functions** | Use serverless compute for event-driven tasks in your RAG chat system. Trigger data retrieval, process user queries, or handle background tasks like syncing and cleanup. Build a modular, scalable back end. |

### Low-code and no-code solutions
Some of the logic that you need to implement your generative AI vision can be built quickly and be hosted reliably by using a low-code or no-code solution.
| Product | Description| 
|  --- | ---  |
| **Microsoft Foundry** | You can use [Microsoft Foundry](https://ai.azure.com?cid=learnDocs) to train, test, and deploy custom machine learning models to enhance a RAG chat system. For example, use Microsoft Foundry to customize response generation or to improve the relevance of retrieved information. |

### Vector database
Some generative AI solutions need to store and retrieve data to improve results. For example, a RAG-based chat system lets users chat with your company’s data. In this case, you need a vector database.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/ai/introduction-build-generative-ai-solutions#tools-and-services-from-microsoft"},{"title":"Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate - Certifications","content":"Certification

### Implement an agentic solution (5-10%)

2. Configure the necessary resources to build an agent
3. Create an agent with the Microsoft Foundry Agent Service

5. Implement complex workflows including orchestration for a multi-agent solution, multiple users, and autonomous capabilities

results.content:
# Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution
## Updates to the exam
Our exams are updated periodically to reflect skills that are required to perform a role. We have included two versions of the Skills Measured objectives depending on when you are taking the exam.
We always update the English language version of the exam first. Some exams are localized into other languages, and those are updated approximately eight weeks after the English version is updated. While Microsoft makes every effort to update localized exams as noted, there may be times when the localized versions of an exam are not updated on this schedule. Other available languages are listed in the **Schedule Exam** section of the **Exam Details** webpage. If the exam isn't available in your preferred language, you can request an additional 30 minutes to complete the exam.
#### Note
The bullets that follow each of the skills measured are intended to illustrate how we are assessing that skill. Related topics may be covered in the exam.
#### Note
Most questions cover features that are general availability (GA). The exam may contain questions on Preview features if those features are commonly used.

results.title: Generative AI solutions for developers
results.content:
# Generative AI solutions for developers
## Tools and services from Microsoft
You can use low-code and no-code generative AI tools and services from Microsoft to help you build some or all of your solution. Various Azure services can play pivotal roles. Each contributes to the efficiency, scalability, and robustness of the solution.
### API and SDKs for a code-centric approach
Every generative AI solution uses an LLM. Azure OpenAI gives you all the features in models like GPT-4.
| Product | Description| 
|  --- | ---  |
| **Azure OpenAI** | A hosted service that gives you access to powerful language models like GPT-4. Use APIs to create embeddings, build chat features, and customize results to fit your needs. |

### Execution environments
You need a service to run your business logic, presentation logic, or APIs for generative AI in your apps.
| Product | Description| 
|  --- | ---  |
| **Azure App Service (or other container-based cloud services)** | Host web interfaces or APIs for users to interact with your RAG chat system. Quickly develop, deploy, and scale agentic web apps. Host MCP servers or OpenAPI servers on App Service. Easily manage the front end of your system. See [Integrate AI into your Azure App Service applications](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/overview-ai-integration). |
| **Azure Functions** | Use serverless compute for event-driven tasks in your RAG chat system. Trigger data retrieval, process user queries, or handle background tasks like syncing and cleanup. Build a modular, scalable back end. |

### Low-code and no-code solutions
Some of the logic that you need to implement your generative AI vision can be built quickly and be hosted reliably by using a low-code or no-code solution.
| Product | Description| 
|  --- | ---  |
| **Microsoft Foundry** | You can use [Microsoft Foundry](https://ai.azure.com?cid=learnDocs) to train, test, and deploy custom machine learning models to enhance a RAG chat system. For example, use Microsoft Foundry to customize response generation or to improve the relevance of retrieved information. |

### Vector database
Some generative AI solutions need to store and retrieve data to improve results. For example, a RAG-based chat system lets users chat with your company’s data. In this case, you need a vector database.

results.content:
Certification 

# Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate

 Design and implement an Azure AI solution using Azure AI services, Azure AI Search, and Azure Open AI. 

## At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?levels=intermediate&credential_types=certification)
- Product 

[Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?products=azure&credential_types=certification)
- Role 

[AI Engineer](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?roles=ai-engineer&credential_types=certification)
- Subject 

[Artificial intelligence](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?subjects=artificial-intelligence&credential_types=certification)
- Renewal Frequency 

12 months
- Last Updated 

04/30/2025

## Overview

As a Microsoft Azure AI engineer, you build, manage, and deploy AI solutions that leverage Azure AI.

Your responsibilities include participating in all phases of AI solutions development, including:

- Requirements definition and design
- Development
- Deployment
- Integration
- Maintenance
- Performance tuning
- Monitoring

You work with solution architects to translate their vision. You also work with data scientists, data engineers, Internet of Things (IoT) specialists, infrastructure administrators, and other software developers to:

- Build complete and secure end-to-end AI solutions.
- Integrate AI capabilities in other applications and solutions.

As an Azure AI engineer, you have experience developing solutions that use languages such as:

- Python
- C#

You should be able to use Representational State Transfer (REST) APIs and SDKs to build secure image processing, video processing, natural language processing, knowledge mining, and generative AI solutions on Azure. You should:

- Understand the components that make up the Azure AI portfolio and the available data storage options.
- Be able to apply responsible AI principles.

## The basics of Azure AI Search
### Introduction
Azure AI Search gives developers tools, APIs, and SDKs for building a rich search experience over private, heterogeneous content in web, mobile, and enterprise applications. Search is foundational to any application that surfaces data to users. Common scenarios include catalog or document search, online retail stores, or data exploration over proprietary content.
Searchable data can be in the form of text or vectors and ingested as-is from a data source or enriched by using AI to improve the overall search experience. Developers can convert data int into numerical representations (called vectors), by choosing to call an external machine learning models (known as embedding models). Indexers can optionally include skill sets that support a powerful suite of data enrichment via several [Azure Language in Foundry Tools](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview) capabilities, such as [Named Entity Recognition (NER)](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/named-entity-recognition/overview) and [personally identifiable information (PII) detection](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/personally-identifiable-information/overview), and [Azure Vision in Foundry Tools](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview) capabilities, including [optical character recognition (OCR)](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-ocr) and [image analysis](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-image-analysis).
See the following tabs for more information about how Azure AI Search improves the search experience by using Foundry Tools or other AI systems to better understand the intent, semantics, and implied structure of a customer's content.
**AI enrichment**
[AI enrichment](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/search/cognitive-search-concept-intro) is the application of machine learning models from Foundry Tools over content that is not easily searchable in its raw form. Through enrichment, analysis and inference are used to create searchable content and structure where none previously existed.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/responsible-ai/search/transparency-note?view=foundry-classic#the-basics-of-azure-ai-search"},{"title":"Develop an AI agent with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service - Training","content":"# Develop an AI agent with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service

AI enrichment is an optional extension of the Azure AI Search indexer pipeline that connects to Foundry Tools in the same region as a customer's search service. An enrichment pipeline has the same core components as a typical indexer (indexer, data source, index), plus a skill set that specifies the atomic enrichment steps. A skill set can be assembled by using built-in skills based on the Foundry Tools APIs, such as [Vision](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-image-analysis) and [Language](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview), or [custom skills](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/search/cognitive-search-create-custom-skill-example) that run external code that you provide.
**Vector search**
Vector search is a method of information retrieval where documents and queries are represented in an index as vectors instead of plain text. In vector search, machine learning models, hosted externally from Azure AI Search, generate the vector representations of source inputs, which can be text, images, audio, or video content. This mathematical and normalized representation of content, called vector embeddings, provides a common basis for search scenarios.
When everything is a vector, a query can find a match in vector space, even if the associated original content is in a different media type, such as images versus text, or language than the query. The search engine scans the index looking for vector content that is most similar, that is, the closest, to the vector in the query. Matching on a mathematical vector representation instead of keywords makes it far more likely to find matches that share semantic meaning but are textually distinct, such as "car" and "auto," for example. This gives a more detailed introduction to vector embeddings and how the similarity algorithm works.

results.content:
# Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution
## Skills measured as of December 23, 2025
### Audience profile
As a Microsoft Azure AI engineer, you build, manage, and deploy AI solutions that leverage Azure AI.
Your responsibilities include participating in all phases of AI solutions development, including:
1. Requirements definition and design
2. Development
3. Deployment
4. Integration
5. Maintenance
6. Performance tuning
7. Monitoring
You work with solution architects to translate their vision. You also work with data scientists, data engineers, Internet of Things (IoT) specialists, infrastructure administrators, and other software developers to:
1. Build complete and secure end-to-end AI solutions.
2. Integrate AI capabilities in other applications and solutions.
As an Azure AI engineer, you have experience developing solutions that use languages such as:
1. Python
2. C#
You should be able to use Representational State Transfer (REST) APIs and SDKs to build secure image processing, video processing, natural language processing, knowledge mining, and generative AI solutions on Azure. You should:
1. Understand the components that make up the Azure AI portfolio and the available data storage options.
2. Be able to apply responsible AI principles.
### Skills at a glance
1. Plan and manage an Azure AI solution (20–25%)
2. Implement generative AI solutions (15–20%)
3. Implement an agentic solution (5–10%)
4. Implement computer vision solutions (10–15%)
5. Implement natural language processing solutions (15–20%)
6. Implement knowledge mining and information extraction solutions (15–20%)
### Plan and manage an Azure AI solution (20-25%)
#### Select the appropriate Microsoft Foundry Services
1. Select the appropriate service for a generative AI solution
2. Select the appropriate service for a computer vision solution
3. Select the appropriate service for a natural language processing solution
4. Select the appropriate service for a speech solution
5. Select the appropriate service for an information extraction solution
6. Select the appropriate service for a knowledge mining solution
#### Plan, create and deploy a Microsoft Foundry Service
1. Plan for a solution that meets Responsible AI principles
2. Create an Azure AI resource
3. Choose the appropriate AI models for your solution
4. Deploy AI models using the appropriate deployment options
5. Install and utilize the appropriate SDKs and APIs
6. Determine a default endpoint for a service
7. Integrate Microsoft Foundry Services into a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline

results.title: Transparency note: Azure AI Search
results.content:
# Transparency note: Azure AI Search
## The basics of Azure AI Search
### Introduction
Azure AI Search gives developers tools, APIs, and SDKs for building a rich search experience over private, heterogeneous content in web, mobile, and enterprise applications. Search is foundational to any application that surfaces data to users. Common scenarios include catalog or document search, online retail stores, or data exploration over proprietary content.
Searchable data can be in the form of text or vectors and ingested as-is from a data source or enriched by using AI to improve the overall search experience. Developers can convert data int into numerical representations (called vectors), by choosing to call an external machine learning models (known as embedding models). Indexers can optionally include skill sets that support a powerful suite of data enrichment via several [Azure Language in Foundry Tools](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview) capabilities, such as [Named Entity Recognition (NER)](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/named-entity-recognition/overview) and [personally identifiable information (PII) detection](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/personally-identifiable-information/overview), and [Azure Vision in Foundry Tools](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview) capabilities, including [optical character recognition (OCR)](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-ocr) and [image analysis](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-image-analysis).
See the following tabs for more information about how Azure AI Search improves the search experience by using Foundry Tools or other AI systems to better understand the intent, semantics, and implied structure of a customer's content.
**AI enrichment**
[AI enrichment](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/search/cognitive-search-concept-intro) is the application of machine learning models from Foundry Tools over content that is not easily searchable in its raw form. Through enrichment, analysis and inference are used to create searchable content and structure where none previously existed.

# Connect an Azure AI Search index to Foundry agents (typescript)

## Skills measured as of December 23, 2025
6. Test, optimize and deploy an agent
### Implement computer vision solutions (10-15%)
#### Analyze images
1. Select visual features to meet image processing requirements
2. Detect objects in images and generate image tags
3. Include image analysis features in an image processing request
4. Interpret image processing responses
5. Extract text from images using Azure Vision in Foundry Tools
6. Convert handwritten text using Azure Vision in Foundry Tools
#### Implement custom vision models
1. Choose between image classification and object detection models
2. Label images
3. Train a custom image model, including image classification and object detection
4. Evaluate custom vision model metrics
5. Publish a custom vision model
6. Consume a custom vision model
7. Build a custom vision model code first
#### Analyze videos
1. Use Azure AI Video Indexer to extract insights from a video or live stream
2. Use Azure Vision in Foundry Tools Spatial Analysis to detect presence and movement of people in video
### Implement natural language processing solutions (15–20%)
#### Analyze and translate text
1. Extract key phrases and entities
2. Determine sentiment of text
3. Detect the language used in text
4. Detect personally identifiable information (PII) in text
5. Translate text and documents by using the Azure Translator in Foundry Tools service
#### Process and translate speech
1. Integrate generative AI speaking capabilities in an application
2. Implement text-to-speech and speech-to-text using Azure Speech in Foundry Tools
3. Improve text-to-speech by using Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML)
4. Implement custom speech solutions with Azure Speech in Foundry Tools
5. Implement intent and keyword recognition with Azure Speech in Foundry Tools
6. Translate speech-to-speech and speech-to-text by using the Azure Speech in Foundry Tools service
#### Implement custom language models
1. Create intents, entities, and add utterances
2. Train, evaluate, deploy, and test a language understanding model
3. Optimize, backup, and recover language understanding model
4. Consume a language model from a client application
5. Create a custom question answering project
6. Add question-and-answer pairs and import sources for question answering
7. Train, test, and publish a knowledge base
8. Create a multi-turn conversation
9. Add alternate phrasing and chit-chat to a knowledge base
10. Export a knowledge base
11. Our exams are updated periodically to reflect skills that are required to perform a role. We have included two versions of the Skills Measured objectives depending on when you are taking the exam.

3. Train a custom image model, including image classification and object detection
4. Evaluate custom vision model metrics
5. Publish a custom vision model
6. Consume a custom vision model
7. Build a custom vision model code first
#### Analyze videos
1. Use Azure AI Video Indexer to extract insights from a video or live stream
2. Use Azure Vision in Foundry Tools Spatial Analysis to detect presence and movement of people in video
### Implement natural language processing solutions (15–20%)
#### Analyze and translate text
1. Extract key phrases and entities
2. Determine sentiment of text
3. Detect the language used in text
4. Detect personally identifiable information (PII) in text
5. Translate text and documents by using the Azure Translator in Foundry Tools service
#### Process and translate speech
1. Integrate generative AI speaking capabilities in an application
2. Implement text-to-speech and speech-to-text using Azure Speech in Foundry Tools
3. Improve text-to-speech by using Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML)
4. Implement custom speech solutions with Azure Speech in Foundry Tools
5. Implement intent and keyword recognition with Azure Speech in Foundry Tools
6. Translate speech-to-speech and speech-to-text by using the Azure Speech in Foundry Tools service
#### Implement custom language models
1. Create intents, entities, and add utterances
2. Train, evaluate, deploy, and test a language understanding model
3. Optimize, backup, and recover language understanding model
4. Consume a language model from a client application
5. Create a custom question answering project
6. Add question-and-answer pairs and import sources for question answering
7. Train, test, and publish a knowledge base
8. Create a multi-turn conversation
9. Add alternate phrasing and chit-chat to a knowledge base
10. Export a knowledge base
11. Create a multi-language question answering solution

results.title: Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution
results.content:
# Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution
## Skills measured as of December 23, 2025
12. Implement custom translation, including training, improving, and publishing a custom model
### Implement knowledge mining and information extraction solutions (15–20%)
#### Implement an Azure AI Search solution
1. Provision an Azure AI Search resource, create an index, and define a skillset
2. Create data sources and indexers
3. Implement custom skills and include them in a skillset
4. Create and run an indexer
5. Query an index, including syntax, sorting, filtering, and wildcards
6. Manage Knowledge Store projections, including file, object, and table projections
7. Implement semantic and vector store solutions
#### Implement an Azure Document Intelligence in Foundry Tools solution
1. Provision a Document Intelligence resource
2. Use prebuilt models to extract data from documents
3. Implement a custom document intelligence model
4. Train, test, and publish a custom document intelligence model
5. Create a composed document intelligence model
#### Extract information with Azure Content Understanding in Foundry Tools
1. Create an OCR pipeline to extract text from images and documents
2. Summarize, classify, and detect attributes of documents
3. Extract entities, tables, and images from documents
4. Process and ingest documents, images, videos, and audio with Azure Content Understanding in Foundry Tools

results.title: Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution
results.content:
# Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution
## Updates to the exam
Our exams are updated periodically to reflect skills that are required to perform a role. We have included two versions of the Skills Measured objectives depending on when you are taking the exam.
We always update the English language version of the exam first. Some exams are localized into other languages, and those are updated approximately eight weeks after the English version is updated. While Microsoft makes every effort to update localized exams as noted, there may be times when the localized versions of an exam are not updated on this schedule. Other available languages are listed in the **Schedule Exam** section of the **Exam Details** webpage. If the exam isn't available in your preferred language, you can request an additional 30 minutes to complete the exam.
#### Note
The bullets that follow each of the skills measured are intended to illustrate how we are assessing that skill. Related topics may be covered in the exam.
#### Note
Most questions cover features that are general availability (GA). The exam may contain questions on Preview features if those features are commonly used.
